JobMetadata.PlainText:
JobTitle: Program Manager Description:
We have an on-going programme that needs full-time project/programme management support from an experienced and keen individual as it expands.

This opportunity initially is running from now until the end of December 2021; we would hope to extend upon review late November.


This person will work within the Global Agency Investment team, working very closely with a variety of senior level stakeholders (both internal and external) as well as our Facebook Solutions Engineering teams to deliver this global programme.


The aim of this global programme is to partner with Agencies to improve their tech tools and solutions. It is one of our newest and most exciting programs and is growing rapidly. This role will involve managing the commercial aspects of this program (and project selection) from beginning to end across a selection of the existing agency client groups. There will also be opportunity to support/manage Pilot programs as we scale this initiative to new partners.


Team


The Global Agency Investments team are enthusiastic solution-drivers who will work closely with several internal and external partners on projects that transform our relationships with Agencies across the globe


Success in this position requires the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment, managing multiple projects simultaneously with a diverse set of stakeholders and participants.


The ideal person will have a solid understanding of the Agency landscape and the macro trends that affect these businesses and its clients. They will have a proven experience of project/programme management. They will be hands-on and a self-starter with good initiative.


This is a full time role and is based in London.


Core Responsibilities:


Project Management - Proactively manage multiple projects concurrently, engaging different stakeholders at relevant times while keeping a wider XFN group updated. They will apply a commercial lens at all times and have a deep understanding of the project ROI and effectiveness.

Program Development & Commercial Strategy - Meaningfully contribute to the strategic development of the wider program, working collaboratively to shape existing program processes and, as projects complete, support scaling and development of internal marketing strategies. They will also support growth of the program by leading onboarding of new pilot partners as we expand.

Stakeholder Management - Strong communication skills and ability to manage a range of situations. This role requires someone who is able to lead and manage a senior client facing program as well as manage and collaborate with a wide range of Internal Stakeholders.

Ownership/Responsibility - The successful candidate takes responsibility for, and drives, the program while recognising that they are a facilitator not an “owner”. They lead through consultation, influencing and consensus, they are “finishers” and subscribe to the principle “Nothing at Facebook is somebody else’s problem”


Requirements & Background


BA/BSc required

Minimum 10 years Agency, Marketing or Project Management experience.

Background/previous experience of commercial/investment within Media or marketing sector is strongly preferred.

Proven experience to drive performance and commercial arguments through data with senior stakeholders

Intermediate excel skills are essential, Advanced (e.g. high comfort level consolidating and joining large data sets) is a plus

Self-motivated, entrepreneurial in nature and comfortable in ambiguous situations.

Exceptional written/oral communication skills

Outstanding organizational qualities

Extremely proactive in their approach

Ability to build relationships and work effectively with peers and managers, both internally and externally across a variety of disciplines
 Skills: Marketing, Stakeholder Management
